page.title: 03CONGLETON EDGE
page.content: It was a lovely LANDSCAPE you could see for miles.It was a fantastic view.The hedges were really overgrown.On the west side there was a SCARP SLOPE.This was mainly made of grit and surrounded by trees.The vegetation beneath the SCARPE SLOPE was lush.The SCARP SLOPE and the vegetation were the main GEOLOGICAL features of Congleton Edge.The east side sloped into farmland which contained rough grazing for the cattle.DAIRY FARMING dominated the LANDSCAPE.When you looked to the west you could see a couple of goats.The ground was very soft,although there were many stones embedded in the paths.The walk was about a mile long there and back.It took us half an hour at a steady speed.It was very quiet and lonely up there.
